item.title: Flooding on the road and pavement, 4th February
item.description:
The pavement and road here are impassable when it rains - the pavement is uneven and floods and the road has large puddles in the bus lane
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 402, Seven Sisters Road, Stoke Newington, Greater London

item.title: Rubbish dump, 4th February

item.title: Illegal Parking Blocking Access, 4th February
item.description:
Subject Illegal Parking Blocking Access Hello, As you can see in the attached picture, people are using this area for parking, even though parking is not allowed here.Woodsford building Portland Street London The vehicles are blocking the entrance, which makes it impossible to remove the rubbish and access the area properly. Could you please send local officers to address this issue? Thank you for your assistance. Kind regards,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Portland Street, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gaping pothole at bottom of Riverdale Road, 4th February
item.description:
Pot hole at intersection of Riverdale Road and plumstead high street Cars coming down sloping Riverdale Road hit it and touch the road with bumpers. Only a matter of time until liability claims will start to flow in

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Plumstead High Street, Plumstead

item.title: Fridge Freezers and Bed Mattress in Charlton Village Carpark, 4th February
item.description:
Fly tipping - it started with fridge freezers and now a mattress has been dumped there. It's beginning to build up.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): The Village, Charlton

item.title: Dog fouling and littering at the junction of Wendover Road and Siward Road, 4th February
item.description:
It is unfortunate that we have received an email that the reported problem has been fixed on 3rd of Feb when clearly the dog fouling and littering has not been addressed. This is evident from the photo taken today, the 4th of Feb. This is a fourth request to address this and take appropriate measures to prevent this from happening again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Siward Road, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole, 4th February
item.description:

item.title: A stone bollard has been knocked down and is now a serious hazard on the public highway. It needs to be made safe, removed, and properly repaired as a priority., 4th February
item.description:
One of the stone bollards has been struck and knocked over. It is no longer secure and poses a danger to pedestrians and other road users, as it could cause trips, falls, or collisions. In its current state, it is unsafe and requires urgent attention

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wenlock Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole, 4th February
item.description:
One on both sides of the junction of Southwark Bridge Road and Southwark Street. Both potholes are just before the traffic light. This one on the side of traffic heading southbound.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bankside, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
